AutocompleteInteraction.description: Represents an application command autocomplete interaction. See Interaction for more properties.

props.description: Whether or not the interaction has been acknowledged

props.description: The ID of the interaction
props.name: id

props.description: The member who triggered the interaction (This is only sent when the interaction is invoked within a guild)
props.name: member

props.description: The interaction token (Interaction tokens are valid for 15 minutes after initial response and can be used to send followup messages but you must send an initial response within 3 seconds of receiving the event. If the 3 second deadline is exceeded, the token will be invalidated.)
props.name: token

props.description: 1 is a Ping, 2 is an Application Command, 3 is a Message Component
props.name: type

props.description: The user who triggered the interaction (This is only sent when the interaction is invoked within a dm)
props.name: user

props.description: The interaction version
props.name: version

Channel.name: Channel

props.name: id

params.description: The auth token to use. Bot tokens should be prefixed with `Bot` (e.g. `Bot MTExIHlvdSAgdHJpZWQgMTEx.O5rKAA.dQw4w9WgXcQ_wpV-gGA4PSk_bm8`). Prefix-less bot tokens are [DEPRECATED]
params.name: token

params.description: Eris client options
params.name: options

params.description: [DEPRECATED] A HTTPS Agent used to proxy requests. This option has been moved under `options.rest`
params.name: options.agent

params.description: A list of mentions to allow by default in createMessage/editMessage
params.name: options.allowedMentions

params.description: Whether or not to allow @everyone/@here.
params.name: options.allowedMentions.everyone

params.description: Whether or not to allow all role mentions, or an array of specific role mentions to allow.
params.name: options.allowedMentions.roles

params.description: Whether or not to allow all user mentions, or an array of specific user mentions to allow.
params.name: options.allowedMentions.users

params.description: Whether or not to mention the author of the message being replied to
params.name: options.allowedMentions.repliedUser

params.description: Have Eris autoreconnect when connection is lost
params.name: options.autoreconnect

params.description: Whether to request WebSocket data to be compressed or not
params.name: options.compress

params.description: How long in milliseconds to wait for the connection to handshake with the server
params.name: options.connectionTimeout

params.description: The default format to provide user avatars, guild icons, and group icons in. Can be "jpg", "png", "gif", or "webp"
params.name: options.defaultImageFormat

params.description: The default size to return user avatars, guild icons, banners, splashes, and group icons. Can be any power of two between 16 and 2048. If the height and width are different, the width will be the value specified, and the height relative to that
params.name: options.defaultImageSize

params.description: If disableEvents[eventName] is true, the WS event will not be processed. This can cause significant performance increase on large bots. [A full list of the WS event names can be found on the docs reference page](/Eris/docs/reference#ws-event-names)
params.name: options.disableEvents

params.description: The ID of the first shard to run for this client
params.name: options.firstShardID

params.description: Get all the users in every guild. Ready time will be severely delayed
params.name: options.getAllUsers

params.description: How long in milliseconds to wait for a GUILD_CREATE before "ready" is fired. Increase this value if you notice missing guilds
params.name: options.guildCreateTimeout

params.description: A list of intents, or raw bitmask value describing the intents to subscribe to. Some intents, like `guildPresences` and `guildMembers`, must be enabled on your application's page to be used. By default, all non-privileged intents are enabled.
params.name: options.intents

params.description: The maximum number of offline users per guild during initial guild data transmission
params.name: options.largeThreshold

params.description: The ID of the last shard to run for this client
params.name: options.lastShardID

params.description: [DEPRECATED] The average request latency at which Eris will start emitting latency errors. This option has been moved under `options.rest`
params.name: options.latencyThreshold

params.description: The maximum amount of times that the client is allowed to try to reconnect to Discord.
params.name: options.maxReconnectAttempts

params.description: The maximum amount of times a shard can attempt to resume a session before considering that session invalid.
params.name: options.maxResumeAttempts

params.description: The total number of shards you want to run. If "auto" Eris will use Discord's recommended shard count.
params.name: options.maxShards

params.description: The maximum size of a channel message cache
params.name: options.messageLimit

params.description: Whether to suppress the Opus encoder not found error or not
params.name: options.opusOnly

params.description: [DEPRECATED] A number of milliseconds to offset the ratelimit timing calculations by. This option has been moved under `options.rest`
params.name: options.ratelimiterOffset

params.description: A function which returns how long the bot should wait until reconnecting to Discord.
params.name: options.reconnectDelay

params.description: A number of milliseconds before requests are considered timed out. This option will stop affecting REST in a future release; that behavior is [DEPRECATED] and replaced by `options.rest.requestTimeout`
params.name: options.requestTimeout

params.description: Options for the REST request handler
params.name: options.rest

params.description: A HTTPS Agent used to proxy requests
params.name: options.rest.agent

params.description: The base URL to use for API requests. Defaults to `/api/v${REST_VERSION}`
params.name: options.rest.baseURL

params.description: [DEPRECATED] Whether reasons should be decoded with `decodeURIComponent()` when making REST requests. This is true by default to mirror pre-0.15.0 behavior (where reasons were expected to be URI-encoded), and should be set to false once your bot code stops. Reasons will no longer be decoded in the future
params.name: options.rest.decodeReasons

params.description: Whether to disable the built-in latency compensator or not
params.name: options.rest.disableLatencyCompensation

params.description: The domain to use for API requests
params.name: options.rest.domain

params.description: The average request latency at which Eris will start emitting latency errors
params.name: options.rest.latencyThreshold

params.description: A number of milliseconds to offset the ratelimit timing calculations by
params.name: options.rest.ratelimiterOffset

params.description: A number of milliseconds before REST requests are considered timed out
params.name: options.rest.requestTimeout

params.description: Whether to enable getting objects over REST. Even with this option enabled, it is recommended that you check the cache first before using REST
params.name: options.restMode

params.description: Whether to populate bot.voiceConnections with existing connections the bot account has during startup. Note that this will disconnect connections from other bot sessions
params.name: options.seedVoiceConnections

params.description: An object of WebSocket options to pass to the shard WebSocket constructors
params.name: options.ws

params.description: The command label
params.name: label

params.description:
A response string, array of functions or strings, or function that generates a string or array of strings when called.
If a function is passed, the function will be passed a Message object and an array of command arguments. The Message object will have an additional property `prefix`, which is the prefix used in the command.
`generator(msg, args)`
params.name: generator

params.description: Command options
params.name: options

params.description: An array of command aliases
params.name: options.aliases

params.description: If arguments are required or not
params.name: options.argsRequired

params.description: Whether the command label (and aliases) is case insensitive or not
params.name: options.caseInsensitive

params.description: The cooldown between command usage in milliseconds
params.name: options.cooldown

params.description: A set of factors that limit where cooldowns are active
params.name: options.cooldownExclusions

params.description: An array of user IDs representing users that are not affected by cooldowns.
params.name: options.cooldownExclusions.userIDs

params.description: An array of guild IDs representing guilds that are not affected by cooldowns.
params.name: options.cooldownExclusions.guildIDs

params.description: An array of channel IDs representing channels that are not affected by cooldowns.
params.name: options.cooldownExclusions.channelIDs

params.description: A string or `createMessage()` content object, or a function that returns either of those, to show when the command is on cooldown.  The function is passed the Message object as a parameter.
params.name: options.cooldownMessage

params.description: Number of times to return a message when the command is used during it's cooldown.  Once the cooldown expires this is reset.  Set this to 0 to always return a message.
params.name: option.cooldownReturns

params.description: Default subcommand options. This object takes the same options as a normal Command
params.name: options.defaultSubcommandOptions

params.description: Whether to delete the user command message or not
params.name: options.deleteCommand

params.description: A short description of the command to show in the default help command
params.name: options.description

params.description: Whether to prevent the command from being used in guilds or not
params.name: options.dmOnly

params.description: A string or `createMessage()` content object, or a function that returns either of those, to show if the execution of the command handler somehow fails.  The function is passed the Message object as a parameter.
params.name: options.errorMessage

params.description: A detailed description of the command to show in the default help command
params.name: options.fullDescription

params.description: Whether to prevent the command from being used in Direct Messages or not
params.name: options.guildOnly

params.description: Whether or not the command should be hidden from the default help command list.
params.name: options.hidden

params.description: A set of functions to be executed at different times throughout the command's processing
params.name: options.hooks

params.description: A function that is executed before any permission or cooldown checks is made. The function is passed the command message and arguments as parameters.
params.name: options.hooks.preCommand

params.description: A function that is executed after all checks have cleared, but before the command is executed. The function is passed the command message, arguments, and if command checks were passed as parameters.
params.name: options.hooks.postCheck

params.description: A function that is executed after the command is executed, regardless of the final failed state of the command. The function is passed the command message, arguments, and if execution succeeded as parameters.
params.name: options.hooks.postExecution

params.description: A function that is executed after a response has been posted, and the command has finished processing. The function is passed the command message, arguments, and the response message (if applicable) as parameters.
params.name: options.hooks.postCommand

params.description: A string or `createMessage()` content object, or a function that returns either of those, to show when a command was improperly used.  The function is passed the Message object as a parameter.
params.name: options.invalidUsageMessage

params.description: A string or `createMessage()` content object, or a function that returns either of those, to show when the user doesn't have permissions to use the command.  The function is passed the Message object as a parameter.
params.name: options.permissionMessage

params.description:
An array of objects specifying reaction buttons
`emoji` specifies the button emoji. Custom emojis should be in format `emojiName:emojiID`
`type` specifies the type of the reaction button, either "edit" or "cancel"
`response` specifies the content to edit the message to when the reaction button is pressed. This accepts the same arguments as the `generator` parameter of this function, but with an extra userID parameter for generator functions (`function(msg, args, userID)`) describing the user that made the reaction
`filter` specifies a function (`function(msg, emoji, userID)`) that filters message reactions. If the function returns false, the reaction is not treated as a valid reaction button response
params.name: options.reactionButtons

params.description: Time (in milliseconds) to wait before invalidating the command's reaction buttons
params.name: options.reactionButtonTimeout

params.description: A set of factors that limit who can call the command
params.name: options.requirements

params.description: An array or a function that returns an array of user IDs representing users that can call the command.  The function is passed the Message object as a parameter.
params.name: options.requirements.userIDs

params.description:
An object or a function that returns an object containing permission keys the user must match to use the command.  The function is passed the Message object as a parameter.
i.e.:
```
{
  "administrator": false,
  "manageMessages": true
}
```
In the above example, the user must not have administrator permissions, but must have manageMessages to use the command
params.name: options.requirements.permissions

params.description: An array or a function that returns an array of role IDs that would allow a user to use the command.  The function is passed the Message object as a parameter.
params.name: options.requirements.roleIDs

params.description: An array or a function that returns an array of role names that would allow a user to use the command.  The function is passed the Message object as a parameter.
params.name: options.requirements.roleNames

params.description: A function that accepts a message and returns true if the command should be run
params.name: options.requirements.custom

params.description: Whether or not to restart a command's cooldown every time it's used.
params.name: option.restartCooldown

params.description: Details on how to call the command to show in the default help command
params.name: options.usage

In the above example, the user must not have administrator permissions, but must have manageMessages to use the command

methods.description: Register a command
methods.name: registerCommand

params.description: The command label
params.name: label

params.description:
A response string, array of functions or strings, or function that generates a string or array of strings when called.
If a function is passed, the function will be passed a Message object and an array of command arguments. The Message object will have an additional property `prefix`, which is the prefix used in the command.
`generator(msg, args)`
params.name: generator

params.description: Command options
params.name: options

params.description: An array of command aliases
params.name: options.aliases

params.description: If arguments are required or not
params.name: options.argsRequired

params.description: Whether the command label (and aliases) is case insensitive or not
params.name: options.caseInsensitive

params.description: The cooldown between command usage in milliseconds
params.name: options.cooldown

params.description: A set of factors that limit where cooldowns are active
params.name: options.cooldownExclusions

params.description: An array of user IDs representing users that are not affected by cooldowns.
params.name: options.cooldownExclusions.userIDs

params.description: An array of guild IDs representing guilds that are not affected by cooldowns.
params.name: options.cooldownExclusions.guildIDs

params.description: An array of channel IDs representing channels that are not affected by cooldowns.
params.name: options.cooldownExclusions.channelIDs

params.description: A string or a function that returns a string to show when the command is on cooldown
params.name: options.cooldownMessage

params.description: Number of times to return a message when the command is used during it's cooldown.  Once the cooldown expires this is reset.  Set this to 0 to always return a message.
params.name: option.cooldownReturns

params.description: Default subcommand options. This object takes the same options as a normal Command
params.name: options.defaultSubcommandOptions

params.description: Whether to delete the user command message or not
params.name: options.deleteCommand

params.description: A short description of the command to show in the default help command
params.name: options.description

params.description: Whether to prevent the command from being used in guilds or not
params.name: options.dmOnly

params.description: A string or a function that returns a string to show if the execution of the command handler somehow fails. The function is passed the command message and the error as parameters.
params.name: options.errorMessage

params.description: A detailed description of the command to show in the default help command
params.name: options.fullDescription

params.description: Whether to prevent the command from being used in Direct Messages or not
params.name: options.guildOnly

params.description: Whether or not the command should be hidden from the default help command list
params.name: options.hidden

params.description: A set of functions to be executed at different times throughout the command's processing
params.name: options.hooks

params.description: A function that is executed before any permission or cooldown checks is made. The function is passed the command message and arguments as parameters.
params.name: options.hooks.preCommand

params.description: A function that is executed after all checks have cleared, but before the command is executed. The function is passed the command message, arguments, and if command checks were passed as parameters.
params.name: options.hooks.postCheck

params.description: A function that is executed after the command is executed, regardless of the final failed state of the command. The function is passed the command message, arguments, and if execution succeeded as parameters.
params.name: options.hooks.postExecution

params.description: A function that is executed after a response has been posted, and the command has finished processing. The function is passed the command message, arguments, and the response message (if applicable) as parameters.
params.name: options.hooks.postCommand

params.description: A string or a function that returns a string to show when a command was improperly used
params.name: options.invalidUsageMessage

params.description: A string or a function that returns a string to show when the user doesn't have permissions to use the command
params.name: options.permissionMessage

params.description:
An array of objects specifying reaction buttons
`emoji` specifies the button emoji. Custom emojis should be in format `emojiName:emojiID`
`type` specifies the type of the reaction button, either "edit" or "cancel"
`response` specifies the content to edit the message to when the reaction button is pressed. This accepts the same arguments as the `generator` parameter of this function, but with an extra userID parameter for generator functions (`function(msg, args, userID)`) describing the user that made the reaction
`filter` specifies a function (`function(msg, emoji, userID)`) that filters message reactions. If the function returns false, the reaction is not treated as a valid reaction button response
params.name: options.reactionButtons

params.description: Time (in milliseconds) to wait before invalidating the command's reaction buttons
params.name: options.reactionButtonTimeout

params.description: A set of factors that limit who can call the command
params.name: options.requirements

params.description: An array or a function that returns an array of user IDs representing users that can call the command
params.name: options.requirements.userIDs

params.description:
An object or a function that returns an object containing permission keys the user must match to use the command
i.e.:
```
{
  "administrator": false,
  "manageMessages": true
}
```
In the above example, the user must not have administrator permissions, but must have manageMessages to use the command
params.name: options.requirements.permissions

params.description: An array or a function that returns an array of role IDs that would allow a user to use the command
params.name: options.requirements.roleIDs

params.description: An array or a function that returns an array of role names that would allow a user to use the command
params.name: options.requirements.roleNames

params.description: A function that accepts a message and returns true if the command should be run
params.name: options.requirements.custom

params.description: Whether or not to restart a command's cooldown every time it's used.
params.name: option.restartCooldown

params.description: Details on how to call the command to show in the default help command
params.name: options.usage

GuildAuditLogEntry.description: Represents a guild audit log entry describing a moderation action
GuildAuditLogEntry.name: GuildAuditLogEntry

props.description: The action type of the entry. See Constants.AuditLogActions for more details
props.name: actionType

props.description:
The properties of the targeted object after the action was taken
For example, if a channel was renamed from #general to #potato, this would be `{name: "potato"}``
props.name: after

props.description:
The properties of the targeted object before the action was taken
For example, if a channel was renamed from #general to #potato, this would be `{name: "general"}``
props.name: before

props.description: The channel targeted in the entry, action types 26 (MEMBER_MOVE), 72/74/75 (MESSAGE_DELETE/PIN/UNPIN) and 83/84/85 (STAGE_INSTANCE_CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE) only
props.name: channel

props.description:
The number of entities targeted
For example, for action type 26 (MEMBER_MOVE), this is the number of members that were moved/disconnected from the voice channel
props.name: count

props.description: The number of days of inactivity to prune for, action type 21 (MEMBER_PRUNE) only
props.name: deleteMemberDays

props.description: The guild containing the entry
props.name: guild

props.description: The ID of the entry
props.name: id

props.description: The member described by the permission overwrite, action types 13-15 (CHANNEL\_OVERWRITE\_CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE) only. If the member is not cached, this could be {id: String}
props.name: member

props.description: The number of members pruned from the server, action type 21 (MEMBER_PRUNE) only
props.name: membersRemoved

props.description: The message that was (un)pinned, action types 74/75 (MESSAGE_PIN/UNPIN) only. If the message is not cached, this will be an object with an `id` key. No other property is guaranteed.
props.name: message

props.description: The reason for the action
props.name: reason

props.description: The role described by the permission overwrite, action types 13-15 (CHANNEL\_OVERWRITE\_CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE) only. If the role is not cached, this could be {id: String, name: String}
props.name: role

props.description:
The object of the action target
If the item is not cached, this property will be null
If the action targets a guild, this could be a Guild object
If the action targets a guild channel, this could be a CategoryChannel, TextChannel, or VoiceChannel object
If the action targets a member, this could be a Member object
If the action targets a role, this could be a Role object
If the action targets an invite, this is an Invite object
If the action targets a webhook, this is null
If the action targets a emoji, this could be an emoji object
If the action targets a sticker, this could be a sticker object
If the action targets a message, this is a User object
props.name: target

props.description: The ID of the action target
props.name: targetID

props.description: The user that performed the action
props.name: user

props.description: The denied permissions number

props.description:
A JSON representation of the permissions number.
If a permission key isn't there, it is not set by this permission.
If a permission key is false, it is denied by the permission.
If a permission key is true, it is allowed by the permission.
i.e.:
{
  "readMessages": true,
  "sendMessages": true,
  "manageMessages": false
}
In the above example, readMessages and sendMessages are allowed permissions, and manageMessages is denied. Everything else is not explicitly set.
[A full list of permission nodes can be found on the docs reference page](/Eris/docs/reference)
props.name: json

methods.description: Check if this permission allows a specific permission
methods.name: has

params.description: The name of the permission. [A full list of permission nodes can be found on the docs reference page](/Eris/docs/reference)
params.name: permission

returns.description: Whether the permission allows the specified permission

If a permission key is true, it is allowed by the permission.
i.e.:
{
  "readMessages": true,
  "sendMessages": true,
  "manageMessages": false
}
In the above example, readMessages and sendMessages are allowed permissions, and manageMessages is denied. Everything else is not explicitly set.
[A full list of permission nodes can be found on the docs reference page](/Eris/docs/reference)
